1.text: Hear therefore, O Job, my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

2.text: Behold now I have opened my mouth, let my tongue speak within my jaws.

3.text: My words are from my upright heart, and my lips shall speak a pure sentence.

4.text: The spirit of God made me, and the breath of the Almighty gave me life.

5.text: If thou canst, answer me, and stand up against my face.

6.text: Behold God hath made me as well as thee, and of the same clay I also was formed.

7.text: But yet let not my wonder terrify thee, and let not my eloquence be burdensome to thee.

8.text: Now thou has said in my hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words :

9.text: I am clean, and without sin : I am unspotted, and there is no iniquity in me.

10.text: Because he hath found complaints against me, therefore he hath counted me for his enemy.

11.text: He hath put my feet in the stocks, he hath observed all my paths.

12.text: Now this is the thing in which thou art not justified : I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

13.text: Dost thou strive against him, because he hath not answered thee to all words?

14.text: God speaketh once, and repeateth not the selfsame thing the second time.

15.text: By a dream in a vision by night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, and they are sleeping in their beds :

16.text: Then he openeth the ears of men, and teaching instructeth them in what they are to learn.

17.text: That he may withdraw a man from the things he is doing, and may deliver him from pride.

18.text: Rescuing his soul from corruption : and his life from passing to the sword.

19.text: He rebuketh also by sorrow in the bed, and he maketh all his bones to wither.

20.text: Bread becometh abominable to him in his life, and to his soul the meat which before he desired.

21.text: His flesh shall be consumed away, and his bones that were covered shall be made bare.

22.text: His soul hath drawn near to corruption, and his life to the destroyers.

23.text: If there shall be an angel speaking for him, one among thousands, to declare manâ€™s uprightness,

24.text: He shall have mercy on him, and shall say : Deliver him, that he may not go down to corruption : I have found wherein I may be merciful to him.

25.text: His flesh is consumed with punishment, let him return to the days of his youth.

26.text: He shall pray to God, and he will be gracious to him : and he shall see his face with joy, and he will render to man his justice.

27.text: He shall look upon men, and shall say : I have sinned, and indeed I have offended, and I have not received what I have deserved.

28.text: He hath delivered his soul from going into destruction, that it may live and see the light.

29.text: Behold, all these things God worketh three times within every one.

30.text: That he may withdraw their souls from corruption, and enlighten them with the light of the living.

31.text: Attend, Job, and hearken to me : and hold thy peace, whilst I speak.

32.text: But if thou hast any thing to say, answer me, speak : for I would have thee to appear just.

33.text: And if thou have not, hear me : hold thy peace, and I will teach thee wisdom.
